contexts.context: ...continued on until he reached the second youngest Coribael brother, <mark>Feryn</mark>, who not only was as fast as Vanis, but...
...Baranat hid himself and trembled as he looked at the giant <mark>Feryn</mark> Coribael. Again, the young adventurer prayed to the saints....
Baranat rushed at <mark>Feryn</mark>, knocking the giant through a boulder which turned to dust...
...giant through a boulder which turned to dust on impact. <mark>Feryn</mark> tried to get to his feet, but Baranat tore him...
...across the valley floor in eighty-seven pieces. Beyond <mark>Feryn's</mark> post was a raging river, where the second eldest Coribael...
...was faster than his brother Vanis, stronger than his brother <mark>Feryn</mark>, and so tough that he could swim in the lava...
